results.title: Mark Margolis, Scene-Stealing Actor in ‘Breaking Bad,’ Dies at 83
results.abstract: His ex-drug lord in a wheelchair was unable to speak, but Mr. Margolis, who also appeared in “Better Call Saul,” didn’t need dialogue to wield fearsome power.

media.caption: Mark Margolis in a scene from “Breaking Bad.” He played the former drug kingpin Hector Salamanca, who communicated by means of a wheelchair bell while living in a New Mexico nursing home.

results.title: For the First Time, There’s a Pill for Postpartum Depression
results.abstract: Because the pill works faster than other antidepressants and is taken for only two weeks, it may encourage more treatment of the debilitating condition.

media.caption: Amy Bingham suffered from postpartum depression in 2018 after giving birth to her son, Benjamin. She received the new drug, zuranolone, in a clinical trial and said her symptoms gradually improved.

results.title: Texas Judge Says Doctors Can Use ‘Good Faith Judgment’ in Providing Abortions
results.abstract: The ruling sought to clarify the medical exceptions in the state’s bans, and was in a response to a lawsuit from women who were denied abortions despite medical emergencies.

media.caption: Amanda Zurawski, right, spoke at a news conference in March about her experience being denied an abortion and nearly losing her life because of Texas’ bans.
